articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: HSBC (HSBA.L) is set to acquire Citigroup's (C.N) China consumer wealth management business, which manages more than $3 billion in assets, two sources with knowledge of the matter said, in a major boost to the London-based bank's business in that country.
articles.title: Exclusive: HSBC to acquire Citigroup China consumer wealth business -sources

articles.author: Tom Westbrook
articles.description: Oil prices scaled one-year highs on Thursday, while world stocks eyed their longest losing streak in two years as worries deepened about persistently high interest rates, sending investors to shelter in the safety of a surging U.S. dollar.
articles.title: Dollar shines as oil surge spooks investors

articles.author: Chris Prentice, Carolina Mandl
articles.description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is finalizing settlements with around two dozen Wall Street firms to resolve investigations into record-keeping lapses, said two people with knowledge of the matter.
articles.title: Exclusive: US SEC nearing settlement with Wall Street firms over WhatsApp probe -sources

articles.author: Raphael Satter
articles.description: Chinese hackers who subverted Microsoft's (MSFT.O) email platform earlier this year managed to steal tens of thousands of emails from U.S. State Department accounts, a Senate staffer told Reuters on Wednesday.
articles.title: Chinese hackers stole 60,000 emails from US State Department in Microsoft hack, Senate staffer says

articles.author: Sam Nussey
articles.description: Sony Group (6758.T) said on Thursday its gaming chief Jim Ryan would retire next March, with group President Hiroki Totoki to become interim CEO during the search for a successor.
articles.title: Sony gaming chief Jim Ryan to retire, group president to be interim head

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: ChatGPT users will now be able to surf the web, Microsoft-backed (MSFT.O) OpenAI said on Wednesday, expanding the data the viral chatbot can access beyond its earlier September 2021 cutoff.
articles.title: ChatGPT users can now browse internet, OpenAI says

articles.author: Casey Hall, Sophie Yu
articles.description: A record number of Chinese are choosing to travel at home this Golden Week holiday, potentially boosting domestic consumption but disappointing travel agents who have been waiting for big-spending tourists to go back abroad since the pandemic ended.
articles.title: Holidays at home for record number of Chinese as economic slowdown bites

articles.author: Tim Reid
articles.description: Former U.S. President Donald Trump's rivals are running out of time to halt his march to the 2024 Republican presidential nomination unless one emerges as a clear alternative in their second debate on Wednesday, party strategists say.
articles.title: Time running out for Trump's Republican 2024 rivals as they face off in second debate

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Trevor Hunnicutt, Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: Private Travis King, the U.S. soldier who ran into North Korea in July, is in U.S. custody and heading home after being expelled by North Korea into China, the United States said on Wednesday.
articles.title: US soldier Travis King heads home after North Korea expels him

articles.author: Joe Brock
articles.description: The United States is backing a new undersea internet cable connecting several Pacific islands, according to a plan for the project seen by Reuters, boosting Washington's interests in a region where it is vying for influence with China.
articles.title: US backs Pacific undersea internet cable amid China competition
